questions.text: Which city is Pakistan's financial capital?
questions.explanation: Karachi is Pakistan's financial and commercial capital, housing the stock exchange and major businesses.

questions.text: The Pakistan Stock Exchange is headquartered in:
questions.explanation: The Pakistan Stock Exchange (formerly KSE, LSE, ISE) is headquartered in Karachi.
Port Qasim is located about 35 km southeast of Karachi, serving as Pakistan's second largest port.

questions.text: Sindh Industrial Trading Estate (SITE) is located in:
questions.explanation: SITE is one of the largest industrial areas in Karachi, established in 1947.

questions.text: Pakistan Steel Mills is located in:
questions.explanation: Pakistan Steel Mills, the country's largest steel mill, is located in Karachi.

questions.text: Which is the major cash crop of Sindh?
questions.explanation: Sugarcane is a major cash crop in Sindh, along with cotton and rice.

questions.text: Sindh contributes approximately what percentage to Pakistan's GDP?
questions.explanation: Sindh contributes approximately 30% to Pakistan's GDP, second only to Punjab.

questions.text: The first bank established in Pakistan was:
questions.explanation: Habib Bank was the first commercial bank established in Pakistan (August 25, 1947).

questions.text: Which international organization provides loans to Pakistan for development?
questions.explanation: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) provides financial assistance and loans to Pakistan.

questions.text: Korangi Industrial Area is located in:
questions.explanation: Korangi Industrial Area is one of the largest industrial zones in Karachi.
